subject: Science
title: Saturn: Lord of the Rings
description: A fast breakdown of Saturn: Lord of the Rings for builders.

hook.text: Saturn's rings are the most spectacular sight in the solar system.

buildup.text: The rings stretch 282,000 km wide but are only about 10 meters thick.

discovery.text: They're made of billions of ice and rock chunks, from dust grains to houses.

twist.text: The rings may be young â€” possibly formed when a moon was torn apart by gravity.

climax.text: Saturn is so light it would float in water â€” if you could find a big enough tub.

punchline.text: Saturn wears a crown of shattered moons. Beauty born from destruction.

quiz.question: What are Saturn's rings primarily made of?
